preqs: AHT1101and enrolled in the Bachelor of Interior Architecture or permission from Unit Coordinator

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {2126%, 2136%, F3001%}

description: This unit introduces the history and theory of selected Australian and international interior architecture since 1968. The unit will also introduce methods for the written, spoken and visual analysis of buildings including site visits, analytical case studies and other forms of analysis. In addition to the theoretical and historical contexts of the spaces studied the unit will investigate their contribution to interior design and spatial practice.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
